name: Court and Country in Early Modern Spain
description: Representative texts (such as ballads, popular and courtly lyric; chivalric, pastoral and picaresque prose, theatre) from the early modern period, studied in relation to the history and society of imperial Spain. Discussion of literary texts as codes of social conduct; issues of urbanization, court culture, social order and disorder, and cultural discourses of identity and difference. (Offered every three years)
prerequisites: SPA120Y1 or SPA220Y1 or SPA219Y1 or Permission of the Department
